intro: Lastrea jessoensis, commonly known as the Korean rock cress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Korea. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard family plants. The plant typically grows in rocky and well-drained soils, often in alpine or subalpine habitats. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are simple and alternate, with a slightly hairy texture adapted to its harsh environment.
